alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Aroostook County through 445 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Eagle Lake to near Fish River Lake. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Caribou, Madawaska, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Woodland, New Canada, Lille, Madawaska Lake, Cross Lake, Fish River Lake, New Sweden, Wallagrass, Grand Isle, Connor, Perham, Stockholm, Winterville, Westmanland, Sinclair and Guerette. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 near Van Buren. State Highway 11 between Winterville and Eagle Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern Maine.
